Modification_Detail.description: An original file written for use with Cassini radio science archive bundles during migration from PDS version 3 (PDS3) to PDS4.

Internal_Reference.comment: A description of the Australia Telescope Compact Array, an array of six 22-m antennas used for collection of Cassini radio science data in 2008.

Facility.name: Paul Wild Observatory
Facility.address: 1828 Yarrie Lake Rd Narrabri NSW 2390 Australia
Facility.description: The Paul Wild Observatory is located about 25 km west of Narrabri, New South Wales, and about 550 km northwest of Sydney, Australia. It is the site of the Australia Telescope Compact Array (ATCA). The observatory also hosts the Culgoora Solar Observatry, a node of the Birmingham Solar Oscillations Network, and an element of the Magnetic Data Acquisition System global magnetometer array. The site is named for the Australian radio astronomer, Paul Wild.
